image.altText: Masked people holding guns stand behind a group kneeling

props.synopsis: Masked gunmen have carried out "extrajudicial executions" in the streets of Gaza City as an expert claims the terror group is trying to regain control of the destroyed enclave.

title.children: Graphic footage shows Hamas executing people in the streets of Gaza

image.altText: hostage handover

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says one of four bodies handed over by Hamas on Tuesday night, local time, is not that of an Israeli hostage.

title.children: One of four bodies handed over by Hamas not a hostage, Israel says

image.altText: Man stands next to Chinese flag at a podium

props.synopsis: Trump may have expressed "shock", but his administration is clearly not surprised at China's willingness to flex its dominance on rare earths.

title.children: Beijing's latest move shocked Trump but Australia sees an opportunity

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The ABC understands that a recent safety assessment found the interim berth would need two additional bollards for the ship to dock there at a cost of $2 million, an option which may not go ahead.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV ship unable to dock at interim berth at Point Henry in Geelong

image.altText: An Afghan Taliban fighter sits next to an anti-aircraft gun.

props.synopsis: A 48-hour ceasefire has been decided between the Pakistan government and the Afghan Taliban regime.

title.children: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to temporary ceasefire after deadly violence

image.altText: Fossil bones arranged in the shape of two hands.

props.synopsis: The first set of ancient hand fossils from an ape-like cousin of humans discovered in Kenya suggest a number of species were capable of making tools 1.5 million years ago.

title.children: 'They've got a power grip': Fossil hands suggests ape-like cousin made tools

image.altText: Vladimir Putin shakes hands with Ahmed al-Sharaa.

props.synopsis: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa has told Russian President Vladimir Putin he would honour all past deals struck between his country and Moscow, a pledge suggesting Moscow's two main military bases in Syria are safe.

title.children: Syrian president to honour past deals with Russia, ask for Assad to be handed over

image.altText: A man in a button-up shirt and tie walking out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: Former Yipirinya School principal Gavin Morris has been found guilty of physically assaulting four students, including choking a pupil and dragging students by the ear.

title.children: Former principal guilty on four counts of physically assaulting students

image.altText: Firefighter standing in dark in front of burning building

props.synopsis: The World Meteorological Organization says carbon dioxide levels in the atmosphere are increasing at rates that have tripled since the 1960s, and emissions from human activities and more wildfires have helped fan a "vicious climate cycle."

title.children: CO2 emissions reached record high in 2024, report finds

image.altText: A military commander with a short back and sides haircut speaking in a conference room.

props.synopsis: Colonel Michael Randrianirina led a rebellion by soldiers that ousted President Andry Rajoelina after weeks of youth-led protests against the government.

title.children: Madagascar military leader says he is 'taking the position of president'

image.altText: Two people on a beach with a large mass of fishing nets in front of them.

props.synopsis: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

title.children: The ocean's least natural predator has come for Australia

image.altText: Indonesian police stand with three suspects of a murder in front of press

props.synopsis: Indonesian police allege Zivan Radmanovic was killed when two Australian men stormed the villa, shooting him.

title.children: Three Australian men could face death penalty after alleged murder in Bali

image.altText: Headshot of a bald man holding a large beer with his fist curled.

props.synopsis: British social media star "Big John" says he is being deported from Australia after apparently failing to comply with visa requirements.

title.children: 'Had better days': UK social media star facing deportation from Perth

image.altText: Peter V'landys speaking to media.

props.synopsis: The Australian Rugby League Commission has announced a 10-year ban for any NRL player who agrees to join a football competition it does not recognise.

title.children: NRL players face 10-year ban for joining rebel leagues

image.altText: An aerial view of a house engulfed in brown floodwaters

props.synopsis: The third day of an inquest into two deaths during the 2022 Eugowra flood hears of concerns raised within the SES about the accuracy of weather bureau warnings.

title.children: 'Inland tsunami' inquest hears of agencies' tension before disaster

image.altText: Smiling girl with I Voted sticker

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Hume Council will see the city's first-ever democratically elected youth mayor take office.

title.children: Should the voting age be lowered? Melbourne’s north is getting a preview

image.altText: A pic of a passport.

props.synopsis: The US passport has fallen to 12th place, a five-spot decline from its previous ranking, tying with Malaysia.

title.children: US drops out of world's most powerful passport top 10 list for the first time

image.altText: Minister for Indigenous Australians Malarndirri McCarthy stands at a lecturn during a press conference.

props.synopsis: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

title.children: 'Demands our country's full attention': Funding threat on Closing the Gap

image.altText: Calvary St Luke's Hospital sign.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian healthcare experts are calling for assurances about the future of a private hospital in Launceston in the wake of a costly infrastructure failure.

title.children: Private hospital's future under scrutiny after major infrastructure failure

image.altText: 15-year-old Dau Akueng was one of two boys killed in a stabbing attack on 7 September, in Cobblebank, Victoria

props.synopsis: A teenager in youth custody over the murders of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek is forcibly arrested by police after he repeatedly refused to attend court.

title.children: Warrant issued as teen refuses to attend court over Cobblebank killings

image.altText: A photo of a man at a press conference. He is wearing a suit ans speaking. Behind him a blurred blue sign says POLICE.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has apologised for releasing data that overstated a drop in the number of victims of crime.

title.children: 'More work to be done': Minister apologises for crime stats bungle

image.altText: A bald man wearing sunglasses and a mask around his chin takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: A lawyer calls for Roland Griffiths to face a life sentence for the murder of his wife, who he doused in petrol and set on fire in Melbourne's north-west in 2022.

title.children: Prosecutors push for house fire murderer to be jailed for life

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump made the comments in reference to Time magazine's upcoming November cover story, detailing how his administration "sealed the Gaza ceasefire deal".

title.children: Trump says glowing magazine cover of him 'may be the Worst of All Time'

image.altText: A boat approaches a southern right whale and her calf

props.synopsis: The latest close encounter with a protected whale species has renewed calls for the public to give the animals space.

title.children: Close whale and calf encounter renews calls for boats to keep back

image.altText: A side-on court sketch of David Pye, showing him with a beard, bald head, ponytail and neck tattoos.

props.synopsis: The man accused of organising the assassination of former Rebels boss Nick Martin believed the bikie had also arranged to have him killed, a Perth court hears.

title.children: Coffin and clapping emojis text to assassin after bikie boss's public killing, court hears

image.altText: A woman with her hands clasped under her pregnant below sitting on a stool in the kitchen

props.synopsis: The baby recession in Australia is deepening as cost of living pressures make the decision for people to have children less of a choice.

title.children: Australia's baby recession deepens as fertility rates hit record low

image.altText: Scattered tin sheets and building degree with flooded road

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says it will no longer publish a cyclone outlook for WA's north, saying it was less reliable due to a changing climate.

title.children: Weather bureau 'retires' cyclone outlook ahead of WA wet season

image.altText: handcuffed man in police station

props.synopsis: Investigators are probing links between a haul of drugs seized on Tuesday and the South-East Asian gang allegedly behind a failed hit in Western Sydney last week.

title.children: Police claim drug seizure linked to failed Sydney daycare hit

image.altText: A happy smiling woman in her 30s with backpack a is holding a thermos mug in a lush outdoor space.

props.synopsis: Do our bodies actually acclimatise when moving from one climate to another and can we do anything to smooth the transition?

title.children: Moving somewhere hotter or colder? This is how long it will take to adjust

image.altText: A woman and a man walk through glass doors, leaving a building

props.synopsis: A mother should be held criminally responsible for the death of her 15-year-old daughter, who she allegedly subjected to physical and emotional abuse for a period of five years, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm.

title.children: 'Treating her as a burden': Mother stands trial over daughter's death

image.altText: boy with hat on on boat

props.synopsis: A total of six children and an adult have been charged with murder after 25-year-old Jack Westren was allegedly stabbed to death at Shellharbour.

title.children: Police charge five more children with murder over train station death

image.altText: Cathy Weeden

props.synopsis: Eighteen months after Canberran Cathy Weeden and her kids purchased a home and left temporary accommodation, she received out-of-the-blue correspondence that she owed $50,000.

title.children: 'I felt like a criminal': Inquiry into debt collection likened to Robodebt

image.altText: Casey-Lee Peters looks into the camera, a bandage covers a port on her chest. There are framed photos in the background.

props.synopsis: A terminal cancer patient is told her failure to declare a UTI has voided her insurance policies, leaving her struggling to pay her mortgage and care for her children in her final days.

title.children: Terminally ill mum's life insurance cancelled after failure to declare UTI

image.altText: Conjoined newborn twins lie amongst blankets in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: The boys, who are only the second known case of conjoined twins born in PNG, are expected to come to Australia for medical treatment.

title.children: 'Surprise' conjoined twins headed for Australia
